Derrick Bell Published articles in Journals 1956-1993 (bound and un-bound)
PUBLICATIONS AND LAW CASES (Boxes 110-119)(See boxes 118 and 119 for works by Bell)
Derrick Bell Published articles in Journals 1956-1993 (bound and un-bound)

- "The Dilemma of the Responsible Law Reform Lawyer in the Post-Free Enterprise Era," from Law & Inequality: A Journal of Theory & Practice, July 1986 (3) -University of San Francisco Law Review, Vol 20, No 3, Spring 1986, "Strangers in Academic Paradise: Law Teachers of Color in Still White Schools" (3) -Nova Law Journal, Vol 10, No 2, Winter 1986, "Application of the 'Tipping Point' Principle to Law Faculty Hiring Policies" (3) -The Harvard Blackletter Journal, Spring 1986, "The Civil Rights Chronicles Revisited: Comments & Intro" (3) - "Equal Opportunity in Higher Education & the Black Public College: The Era of Separate But Equal," Forward by D. Bell from Minnesota Law Review, Oct. 1987 (3) -Minnesota Law Review, Vol 72, No 1, Oct. 1987 "Foreword" -The Georgetown Law Journal, Vol 76, No 1, Oct 1987, "Law, Litigation, & the Search for the Promised Land" (3) -Harvard Law Bulletin, Autumn 1987, Peggy Davis Book review of "And We are not Saved" (2) -Villanova Law Review, Vol 33, No 5, 1988, "White Superiority in AmericaL Its Legal Legacy, Its Economic Costs -The Yale Law Journal, Vol 97, No 8, July 1988, "The Republician Revival & Racial Politics" - Book Review by Preeta D. Bansal on Bell's "And we are not Saved: The Elusive Quest for Racial Justice" from Harvard Law Review, Feb. 1988 (3) - Book Review by Maureen P. Taylor on Bell's "And we are not Saved: The Elusive Quest for Racial Justice" from Michigan Law Review, May 1988 (paper) -NY Law School, Journal of Human Rights, Vol 5, Part 2, Spring 1988, "The Constitution at 200: Reflections on the Past-Implications for the Future" (3) -Michigan Law Review, Vol 87, No 8, Aug 1989, "The Final Report: Harvard's Affirmative Action Allegory" -George Washington Law Review, Vol 57, No 6, Aug 1989, "Xerces & the Affirmative Action Mystique" -UCLA Law Review, Vol 37, No 6, 1990, "Racial Reflections: Dialogues in the Direction of Liberation" -The Yale Journal of Law & Liberation from 1990 Scholarship ball of Mass Black Lawyers Assoc, "The Law of Racial Standing" (3) - "A Student Challenge to the Old Guard" from Student Lawyer Sept. 1990 (article discusses Bell) -The Black Scholar, Vol 22, No 1 & 2, "A Radical Double Agent" (2) - "Political Reality Testing: 1993" from Fordham Law Review Vol. 61, No 5, April 1993 (3)
